description:
We were trying to figure out what to do about dinner on a weeknight and I threw out a few options at him. Oren's Hummus sounded promising and a nice change from what we usually eat.

There's a takeout section and a sit down portion. We decided to eat our dinner there. Our waiter was awesome and made the meal even more enjoyable. He went for the Beef Skewer entree with Oren's Eggplant dip and Falafels. I had the Hummus Beef. Both meals were served with hot fluffy pita bread (you can choose white, wheat, or gluten free pita options). I've had hummus many times before but this was the best tasting hummus I can remember. It also didn't hurt that it was served with spiced ground beef. His Oren's Eggplant was also super delicious and I could've eaten more of that.

It was more food than I had expected. We ordered two entrees but had enough food leftover for another meal for one the next day
author: Yi Z.

description:
* We waited a little more than 15 minutes after we were seated to be able to order food. (The restaurant wasn't packed, there were plenty of empty tables.)
* I specifically mentioned not to have cheese because of the allergy reasons, I received cheese in my plate. They realized much later that I was served cheese. And the excuse was "they didn't read the order sorry". How do you not read an order when you are a restaurant ?
* Our bread basket came after our breakfast was done. So we had breakfast and then received the bread. The reason was " they are baking the croissant" so I guess it takes 40 mins to bake. 
* We have to ask 3 different waiters / waitresses 3 different times to get water. Received the water while we were paying the bills. 

No apologies received by the team and never coming again.
author: Seda B.

description:
I love the idea of hummus as a meal with cool toppings. The whole wheat pita bread is delicious. As a vegetarian, I am very thankful for lots of options that fit my lifestyle, my favorite being the hummus cauliflower. 

I would keep ordering every week except that every time I order there is less and less cauliflower in my hummus. The first time I ordered there was a mountain of cauliflower on my hummus but by the fourth time the mountain turned into a sparse valley. I want Oren's to be a weekly thing so please give me more cauliflower.
author: Veronica L.

description:
This is a great, great lunch option in SF. I'm always a huge fan of anywhere that takes reservations since I'm often lunching with a big group, and Oren's was more than accommodating. We were seated immediately and had great service during our visit.

The lunch vibe at Oren's is lively and busy, and the natural light of this place will definitely wash away the morning work slump. The menu is large, and everything is healthy. You truly can't lose here. I decided to order the rice bowl, and WOW, was I glad I did! This bowl came loaded with turmeric-spiced basmati rice, simmered tomatoes, garlic, onions, mint, and parsley, and was topped with chicken. It was so fresh and the flavor was fantastic. I'm always looking for more ways to get extra turmeric, so this was a big win for me.

I'll definitely be back. This is now in my SF lunch rotation!
author: Aimee K.

description:
Take everything you know about hummus and just chuck it out the window. A hummus bowl is actually just exactly that. A bowl of delish, creamy hummus topped with the meat or veggie of your choice. I got mine with sautéed ground beef. It was delicious and really filling. The pita bread for the table was warm and tasted super fresh. I had to stop myself from eating more than 2 pieces. I came here with a pretty big group and know everyone else enjoyed what they got. They have other dishes besides the hummus bowls (rice bowls, salads, etc.) if that just isn't your thing. 

They have a to go section for people that are just looking to grab food and go but after you walk through that and into the sit down part of the restaurant you'll actually be blown away. The dining area is really spacious, good for groups and has just beautifully decorated. Huge crystal chandeliers aren't usually what you expect in your average lunch spot in FiDi. 

This place blew me away and I totally recommend them. I can't wait to come back next time I am in the city for work.
author: Katarina L.

description:
Never thought I could get this full from a plate of hummus! Came here for a work date and absolutely enjoyed the Hummus Beets bowl. The hummus was so creamy and covered in marinated beets, feta cheese, chopped walnuts, and balsamic reduction. The beets were refreshing and the beet marinade mixed with the balsamic made transformed this hummus "dip" into an actual meal. The pita bread was fresh and warm. I tried not to eat too much of it, because the hummus bowl itself was incredibly filling. 

The atmosphere was quite fancy for a mid-day lunch. It was casual, but the decor was a tad bit swanky with a chandelier hanging overhead. I came with a large group during lunch, and one would definitely need reservations for that (just a little knowledge). 

If I worked nearby, I would likely come here often for yummy and healthy lunch bites.
author: Jennifer B.

description:
One of the best Mediterranean restaurants I have been to lately...

The service was great considering it was a weekday lunch.

And the food - just amazing! 

We had Hummus with Lamb, Hummus with Mushroom, Chicken Schnitzel, Bourekas, Romanian Eggplant and Falafel along with Wheat Pitas. Great flavors and portions. Must visit if you are around.
author: Manoj B.

description:
I've been wanting to try Oren's Hummus for a while. When it popped up as a weekly office lunch option, I figured it was my chance. Our delivery order arrived via Caviar on Friday, October 12th around 12:15pm.

*Chicken Schnitzel: Breaded and fried chicken breast with hummus, tomato, cucumber, and pickles, White Pita ($13.95)
*Quick Fried Cauliflower Florets: With pesto labane ($7)
*Hummus: Served with Whole Wheat Pita, Small (8 oz.): Includes 1 pita ($6)
*Bourekas: Cheese ($1.95), Mushrooms ($1.95)

The best dish out of the three was the cauliflower. Great texture and flavor. Everyone in the office enjoyed it. And it was a huge serving. The schnitzel was okay. Not much filling to pita ratio. I found it too bready. I got the side of hummus and bourekas. The hummus was a good amount. And it was dense. But I found the hummus to be too thick. And I didn't know it was going to be plain, so it didn't have much flavor. It was fine when I added some oil based salad dressing I had at work, but by itself, I didn't really care for it. I did eat some with the bourekas which wasn't too bad. Out of the two pastries, I liked the mushroom one more. It had more flavor with the earthiness of the mushrooms. The cheese one was bland. Not much cheese and too much dough. I kinda ate the inside and discarded the rest.

Maybe I ordered the wrong things, but this just wasn't up my alley. Everything was rather tasteless. If it ever pops up again, I'll give it another go (and probably order something meat centric), but based on everything I ordered, I wasn't impressed. I would have rated them 2 or 2.5 stars, but the cauliflower bumped them up to 3. It saved my meal.
author: Elena N.

description:
Incredible food experience. Their breakfast is open pretty late so it's definitely a good location to come in and grab a late brunch. 

I split the Sampler Dish with another friend and got whole wheat pita. I highly recommend getting this platter because you can try several different things. It comes with a variety of different hummuses and dipping sauces, as well as some vegetable ones too. The pita is really fresh and warm and goes great with all of the dips. For my main dish, I ordered the Challah French Toast and was blown away. It was very simply done, but had a really light taste that made it great - you don't even need that much syrup. The whipped cream and strawberries were a nice touch. Overall, all the food was really good and I hope to make it here again sometime.
author: Sampath D.

description:
During a lunch break with a few co workers, with limited time and all the other places packed, we decided to go to a less busy restaurant but with still amazing reviews! The verdict led us to here! So glad it did because the food was more than impressive! 

I ended up getting the Chicken Schnitzel with a side of sweet potato fries. The chicken schnitzel was perfection, the breaded chicken was so crispy yet moist! The chicken was cut into square pieces and mixed with hummas, tomato and cucumber. Almost similar to a chicken salad sandwich smacked in between pita bread. Hungry just thinking about it. 

I would have given this place 5 stars but honestly wasn't a fan of their sweet potato fries, a little disappointed, maybe it was it was too thick and not crispy enough...

But their Chicken Schnitzel is what would make me return!
author: Amelia L.

description:
Definitely what I'll call Amazingly Fine Casually Fine Dining. Such a great spot. Their hummus bowl is amazing. I always feel satisfied after eating here. I love how they have a separate togo area so that no matter your mood, whether you feel like eating in or eating out, you're not bothered by those doing the other. 

Orens is definitely famous in the bay and they have dishes that can be enjoyed by Vegetarians and meat eaters alike. 

I particularly appreciate the staff who is working the night we visited. It was on the later side of close and we were pretty devastated. They allowed us to order to go and eat while they cleaned up which was so nice. It is always a pleasure to support good people like that.
author: Jacob H.

description:
I've had Oren's Hummus before in the South Bay and was excited to try it in SF. My initial assumptions were the price will be higher and the portions will be smaller. Then I came and was proven half wrong. The price was a bit higher but the portion was pretty decent. While, it's not a lot but it was definitely enough to fill you up. 

I like Oren's because I their food variety. I can either choose to eat healthy or not. Both options are available. I wanted to eat more on the lighter side so I got the Greek salad with grilled chicken. Usually, I'm not a fan of salad but their salad was tossed very well. It was a nice blend of everything. The dressing was on the lighter side so I used their side sauces to add a little spice to it. The chicken was and is still my fave! Full of flavors and juice. 

I also had some pita bread with Greek yogurt hummus. Man, their pita bread is goood. Doesn't matter if it's South Bay or SF, the pita bread is still as good as I can remember it.

Yum. I think I'm gonna come back again and again.
author: Ngoc P.

description: I went to the Contemporary Jewish Museum today and it was a nice outing. I wanted to eat at Wise Sons, but it closed for the day at like 3pm. So I was thinking about heading to the Ferry Building for Wise Sons, but I walked by Oren's Hummus and saw "Israeli food." So I decided to go in and sit down. It was empty besides maybe one couple at like 3-4pm. I looked at the menu, which does not skimp on price. I decided to have the rice bowl with a chicken kebab. They sold me on a Turkish coffee, which I had never had before. The coffee was a small serving and it has some gooey residue at the bottom of it. The chicken rice was good. I had the tahini sauce. And they have two other sauces. It was all good. I took half of the dish for later. I had the complimentary cole slaw and that was good. The service was really nice and it was comfortable. For some reason, I kept getting rice everywhere around me and had to clean up. Anyhow, it was fun. The waitress/hostess was from Macedonia. This is Middle Eastern food/Israeli/whatever, but it's different from other Turkish falafel spots in SF.
author: Denise C.

description:
Phenomenal hummus bowls with lovely presentation. 

I usually order to-go from this particular location, and it rarely disappoints. The restaurant experience in Palo Alto is great, so I'm assuming greatness from this location as well. 

The pita bread with the hummus is amazzzzing. Super fresh. Portions are quite large (for me)... I can never finish a bowl! 

Will definitely keep ordering from this place :)
author: Jenny H.

description:
I was attending Oracle Open World last week and found this place near the Moscone Center for lunch. The ambiance is very modern and we were seated right away. 

The menu has extensive vegetarian options. We ordered the following:
- Falafel Sandwich: Delicious. I loved the mixed flavors of Falafel and the veggies. I ate the whole thing within minutes. 
- Falafel Rice Bowl: OMG - the rice is so soft and delicious. It's an amazing combination and you can't go wrong with this one. 
- Side of Small hummus and Babaganush: the bread is soft and warm and I loved these spreads. 

I wish I had time to eat there again as I wanted to try the other options as well. I highly recommend this place. I wish they had a branch here in DC as well :)
author: Ani J.

description: Great food at reasonable prices.  You can either dinner in like a sit down restaurant or take out at the counter.  I get the beef skewer with sides of falafel, Romanian eggplant dip, and two pitas.  The skewers are really flavorful and moist.  The falafel has great contrast between the crunchy shell and soft center.  And the warm pita is great for picking up the excellent dip.
author: Simon L.

description:
Took my mom here for lunch on a Friday at 12pm. This place was poppin', but they were able to seat us right away. Our waitress was super friendly and attentive! 

I ordered the Traditional Shakshuka ($13.50) which came with whole wheat pita. It was good and filling, though I should have gotten the mozzarella and pesto (+$3) with it because it needed a bit more flavor. 

My mom ordered the Beef Skewer ($18.50) which came with two sides- which she got the Babaganoush Eggplant, falafel side, and also ordered an extra side, the Quick Fried Cauliflower florets ($7). The babaganoush eggplant and falafels were good, but the cauliflower was the true star. I
Also, my mom and I both LOVED the whole wheat pita. It was so warm and soft and filling!! I would come back just for the pita. 

The only thing I would recommend is to offer a wider variety rice bowls (and maybe brown rice option) rather than just hummus bowls.

I would definitely come back here again!
author: April L.

description: Oren's is a cute place with friendly staff and really good food. I got the schnitzel de noir which came with a side of mashed sweet potatoes which were a little dense. My OJ/CJ (carrot juice) 50/50 combo was refreshing after a sweltering hot day. The pastry filled with cheese was not flaky like I was expecting it to be but I can't complain because it was still good. If I am ever in the area and want Israeli fast casual, I'd definitely stop by Oren's.
author: Zain R.

description:
Got this for eat club take out and just had it for lunch at the sit down.  Ordered the ground beef hummus plate both times, and it was delicious.  Usually not a huge hummus fan, but the addition of the spiced ground beef made it sing.

Portion wise, you get a lot so you're definitely not leaving hungry.
author: Tu T.

description: The food here exceed my expectations, although it was a little pricy. You are definitely paying a little more for quality. Everything was super flavorful and delicious. The falafel was not dry, compared to other mediterranean restaurants I have tried. I would highly recommend the babaganoush.
author: Kelly C.

description:
Oren's hummus is a great new addition to the 3rd street and mission area. I love Mediterranean food, so I'm pretty sure I will be a regular here. I've had the cauliflower & hummus and the chicken skewers so far, both were great!

Pro tip: order take out. The service is SO incredibly slow in the dining room. We waited over 45 minutes for our food, and probably 20 minutes for our drinks. Our server kept coming up with excuses about what was going on which was even more annoying. 

This place isn't a place to go if you're trying to save money too. It'll cost you about $14-$20 for lunch. 

I'd give five stars for take out, and three for the dining room which is why I landed on the overall 4 star rating.
author: Morgan J.

description:
Lunch review. Israeli.

5 - Pita
4 - Hummus beef bowl 
4 - Falafel pita sandwich
3 - Bourekas sweet cheese
3 - Sweet potato fries

Overall, "as good as it gets."
author: Mark O.

description:
Living in the Middle East I ate hummus every week for many years of my life. Like anyone from the region, I pride myself as a hummus expert, and usually make it myself. 

The hummus I've had around the Bay Area has been generally mediocre, and the classic mediterranean side dishes similar. Oren's Hummus stands out as the one exception. It's classic Israeli hummus with the option for Arab-style hummus as well (Jaffa). Definitely the best in the Bay.

The only reason why I took a star off is because I never thought I'd ever pay this much for hummus. Or sit in a hummusia with a chandelier hanging overhead...but here we are.

If you're looking for real hummus and don't want to make it yourself, this is the place to go.
author: Hannah P.

description: I am now updating my review to 5 stars just because of the Hummus. I made it a routine each time I'm in town to go for a hummus bowl. No need to order anything else, just get a classic or a sabich hummus (my two favorites), go for the white pitas option and ask for some water and you're all set. You will barely finish the bowl but every bite is heaven, I seriously think this thing is addictive, proper hummus should probably be a controlled substance. I seriously think this hummus is the best I ever had outside the state of Israel, and that's some serious statement to make.
author: Gil S.

description:
Oren's, a refreshing idea in downtown San Francisco. Great food, fresh beverages and service.  I got the rice bowl with grilled chicken.  Absolutely delicious! and homemade lemon juice served with a couple sprigs of fresh mint.
They have a very good menu with many items for meat eaters and vegetarians.

Overall, a really nice experience.
author: Ray M.

description:
Ok, I get the hype! I'm pretty picky about Middle Eastern food because essentials like falafel and pita are more often than not disappointing. Nearly everything I tried at Oren's exceeded my expectations! There are several SOMA/FiDi falafel spots I just can't justify returning to after experiencing Oren's.

Two of us shared 2 dips/sides combos of 3/$12.50 (so 6 total), which was plenty of food and a great deal. It came with 3 pita (we were supposed to get 4, but whatever, it was enough). The run down:

- Whole wheat pita: Warm, fluffy, thick, and wonderful. Competes with James Beard nominee pita I've had, which was mind-blowing.
- Small hummus: This was the disappointment of the bunch and tasted pretty average without any particularly special flavor. Perhaps that's why they have all the fancier hummus options to up-sell you.
- Babaganoush: Our favorite! Wonderful flavor and texture.
- Labane: quite reminiscent of plain cream cheese; I would have liked more za'atar.
- Falafel: Great crunchy outside without being oily, soft inside, and nice flavor from the tahini drizzle. 
- Carrots: yum!
- Traditional Tabule: This won me over. Usually I'm not a tabouli fan because the parsley is heavy-handed but this dish showed restraint.

While we were content and full, we decide to try the Turkish coffee (definitely had that trademark sludge at the bottom) and chocolate babka, which had wonderful warm gooey chocolate and was a little crunchier than I expected.

Service made a couple flubs but was still pleasant. The interior decor is quite elevated for a fast casual spot. When we arrived it was relatively empty, but by the time we left around 8:30 on a Monday night it was pretty full, so the Waitlist feature on Yelp could be a good option. Overall, a solid choice for an easy (and easy on the wallet) weeknight meal.
author: Cristina S.

description:
Oren's Hummus has mastered the art of serving affordable, quality, and healthy breakfast, lunch and dinner options to the Financial District.

I've been to Oren's Hummus a number of times now and each visit has been wonderful. The service has always been professional, quick, and friendly. The menu is delicious and caters to any and all dietary preferences. And the price for portions has been very reasonable. 

You really can't go wrong with anything on Oren's Hummus' menu. It's all made with love, seasoned with skill, and packed with outstanding ingredients.  From their well seasoned meats, to their glorious vegetable dishes, to their creamy hummus bowls, and moist blissful falafel - Oren's has quickly become a downtown favorite. Their ability to accept reservations and their convenient take-out window area - further adds to their dining charm.

If you're looking for a solid lunch or dinner spot in the city for a work gathering or a catch up session with friends - Oren's is your spot.

Trust.
author: Jessica T.

description:
After years of trending in Silicon Valley, Oren's Hummus is now in San Francisco along the art museum corridor, mere steps from the SF Museum of Modern Art, the Contemporary Jewish Museum and the Museum of African Diaspora among many others and I could not wait to finally try it out. In fact, I could not more highly recommend this dining establishment as a great place for a quick bite or for an extended lunch for those who love traditional Mediterranean food from around the entire area like Hummus, Tabula, Babaganoush, Shakshuka, and Fatush.

We came on early on a Friday evening for an early dinner because we had just experienced a great exhibition at the nearby SFMOMA and my dining mate and I were famished. Thankfully, they do have a give you a bowl of pickled cabbage and carrots in a vinegar sauce for you to nosh on. The menu is quite extensive with a variety of their signature hummus bowls, a majority of which were served with a side dish such as cauliflower and mushrooms. We were intrigued by the proteins on the menu that accompanied the hummus's including the lamb, chicken and beef. Also intriguing to the both of us were the beef skewers served with all natural ground beef and lamb with blended herbs and garlic, drizzled with tahini. With that dish we got to select two sides which are separated into two categories: dips and sides. We went with the Babaganoush Eggplant which was fire roasted eggplant mashed with tahini, garlic and herbs and the Marinated Beets which were steamed beets in apple cider cilantro vinaigrette. The beef skewers were four huge meatball pieces that were slightly overcooked on the grill which made them drier than they could have been, but were seasoned nicely and to add a little heat they give you the option of two sauces on every table: red hot chili pepper which were spicy in flavor and jalapeno serrano pepper which was more savory and cool in flavor. Beware the chili pepper was very spicy to your tongue so much so I had to drink multiple glasses of water to cool my taste buds.  

As for the hummus, a friend who had previously been, suggested the Hummus Lamb which was the Classic Hummus topped with pomegranate braised lamb shoulder with fresh mint. The Hummus Bowls come with two pita breads of your choice, while the grilled entrees like the skewers come with just one. We went with the traditional white pita bread and with three full circular pieces that was more than enough. In fact my best suggestion is to pace yourself and to stick with what you get with your meal and then you can order additional pita breads as it cost an additional eighty cents and can get pretty filling.

We loved our time at Oren's, the interior is a bit of a mix match with a grand chandelier in the center of the dining room with menu images along the interior wall that felt more at home at a fast casual restaurant like Panera Bread rather than a fining dining establishment they are trying to set up. There was a minor rush as we were sat along with three other tables and my dining mate was famish so she was disappointed when our server was a little overwhelmed with the service. But the food is the real star here. Overall everything tasted great, well seasoned and interesting. I've never had hummus with a protein like lamb and it tasted great. The surprise was the Babaganoush which I had never had with eggplant and had a real kick to it. I can wait to go back and sample more of their dishes. It sounds cliche, but Oren's is bringing authentic Mediterranean to the masses in a contemporary setting at affordable prices. Multiple visits to sample their extensive menu is a must on any foodie's radar!
author: Jason F.

description:
The first time I went here was for a to-go order since I was starving after Dreamforce. I ordered the chicken rice plate and totally melted into the turmeric tomato rice. So comforting lol

Went back again and we ordered the chicken rice bowl again and the beef skewers. For the skewers you get two sides and pita as well. It's good food to share.

Overall this place is a go for a casual yet trendy ambiance and quality food.
author: Christina M.

description:
It was lunch time and the lines were long for quick food options. After some back and forth between our group we decided to check out Oren's Hummus. There was a spacious dining area as well as an area to order to-go food. 
I decided to get the ground beef skewers dinner with sweet potatoes and hummus. The skewer was ground beef, lamb, garlic and finely diced onion. It was cooked all the way through while still staying juicy. The meal came with a fresh, thick pita. I alternated filling the pita with skewers, sweet potato fries and hummus. It was seriously delicious. The  sweet potato fries were extra crispy and seasoned. I especially enjoyed dipping the sweet potato fries into the hummus. If you're in the downtown San Francisco area I'd definitely recommend checking it out.
author: Christian D.

description:
Funny that I just tried Oren's down in Palo Alto the week before for the first time. I liked it even though making hummus the centerpiece of a restaurant struck me as a bit of a stretch. Well, they fill the menu out with kabobs and sandwiches, but otherwise, it's hummus time (photo: http://bit.ly/2voNC2p). I don't mind as I love hummus and keep pretending it's a low-calorie protein option despite the exorbitant amount of tahini and olive oil that goes into it. I came in really early for supper, around 4:30PM, so there were barely any customers. It's a cavernous space, much bigger than the one in Palo Alto.

What struck me was the number of staff running around since most of them appeared to be in training. As a result, I was getting way more attention than I was expecting, and I really wasn't planning to have a full dinner. Excluding the complimentary Cabbage Salad (photo http://bit.ly/2mYDCJf), which was like Middle Eastern banchan, I went for three of their side portions for $12.50, a pretty good deal, starting with their Small Hummus (photo: http://bit.ly/2M5SFfg). Very creamy and packed with puréed chickpeas though carrying more olive oil than I was hoping. It came with a pita bread and I went for the Whole Wheat - fluffy, tasty, and probably more carbs than I deserved.

The second side was the Chunky Eggplant which they turned almost into a ratatouille with tomatoes and garlic (photo: http://bit.ly/2O0dDfR). Chunky was right and delicious, too. It also came with pita bread, but I rejected it because I didn't want to OD on starches. In fact, my third dish responded to my gluttony with freshness, the Small Israeli Salad, which consisted of chunks of cucumber and tomato with parsley, lemon juice, and of course, olive oil (photo: http://bit.ly/2At90ZT). It provided the balance I felt I needed, and I was sated with my order. Meanwhile, the manager was snapping the troops into shape. I'll come back when the service smooths itself out.

FOOD - 4 stars...good portions, nice ingredients and they do the hummus well except for the excess of oil
AMBIANCE - 3.5 stars...really big space but the vibe was hectic since it was new
SERVICE - 3 stars...a lot of new people, this will presumably self-correct over time
TOTAL - 4 stars...if you want hummus, you get hummus

RELATED - Collection of Mediterranean and Middle Eastern eateries I've tried and reviewed: http://bit.ly/2O0l2Ms
author: Ed U.

description:
Man, what a great place! I came here with a friend for lunch and even though there was a bit of a line, I put myself on the list and were seated within 5 minutes. 

I got the hummus with lamb plate and a side of the chunky eggplant, my friend got his usual, the hummus with beef. At first I was a bit skeptical of eating hummus with meat but it totally works! The lamb was tender and full of flavor, a bit sweet from the pomegranate molasses. The hummus was so creamy and smooth and it's nutty and not super sour like a bunch of the other hummuses. I basically licked my plate. I will be coming here often to get my fix :).
author: Alice W.

description:
I love me some Hummus so I was in Heaven.  What an original concept!  We went here around 1:30 p.m and it was pretty busy.  It took a few minutes, but we got a table.  I sat and absorbed the menu because there was so much to choose from! I decided to go for a more traditional Israeli dish. I got the Hummus with the cauliflower and it doesn't seem like it is going to be filling because it's not huge, but it is!  I was full for hours.  We also shared one of the eggplant sides which was also delicious.  Oh I almost forgot, the pita bread!!!!  By far the best I've had.  I got the whole wheat and my fiance had the regular.  The pieces are big and fluffy and warm!! Can't wait to go back for more.

This place is beautifully decorated and very classy, which is why I was a bit confused about the brown "paper cloths" on each table.  I don't understand why they have them.  The tables must be easy to clean and the tables are very nice to begin with.  To me it made it look cheap and it is wasteful. Another thing was and this may be nit picky, but for such a nice place I felt like the shirts the waiters wore looked like a fast food joint and I was confused it this place was supposed to more formal or not.  At any rate, lovely place with very original and yummy food.  Another nice gesture was one of the owners came out to greet us and that was very sweet and thoughtful.  They also have a take out window that I will use in the future!  I will definitely be back!
author: Megan M.

description:
I came here for lunch with a colleague and absolutely loved it! We were seated right away and there were plenty of seating options, even though we went during full swing lunch time. There were so many delicious options on the menu, it was tough to decide what to order but the waitress was extremely helpful in providing her favorites.

We decided to split the eggplant hummus, which was incredible!!! The fluffy and light pita that accompanied it was exquisite and I would go back just for that. It's a little pricey, but one serving provides enough for one person. 

I also ordered the Shakshuka which is one of my favorite egg dishes of all time. This one had a twist with some pesto and mozzarella on top, which made another great companion to their incredible pita. 

Definitely would go back to Oren's to get another hummus and try their falafel!
author: Isabella L.

description:
Came here a few weeks ago with my husband and had a great meal! We both ordered the beef kafta kabob plate. You have the option of choosing any sides you want with it. It comes with a total of 2. Some choices included yogurt, hummus, babaganoush (eggplant) and so forth! Everything came out very fresh and the pitas are so fluffy. The ambiance inside is so clean and there is a beautiful chandelier hanging from the ceiling. The restaurant just recently opened so everything feels perfect and neatly set up. A staff member at the end handed us to-go boxes, but then took them back and decided to pack our food for us. So nice! 

The only reason I am giving this place a 4-Star is because of the service. For some reason it took a very long time for someone to initially come to our table and take orders from the menus. No one really acknowledge that this even happened.
author: Sophia K.

description:
Was my meal handed to me? Nah.
I earned it. By blade & bloodshed...

We stood in the snow.
Me & Oren Ishii's Hummus.
We drew swords muhfuh.
Long story short, I slayed a bij.

Just like HUMMUS CHICKEN LIVER $16
Y e s. Plus the red hot sauce? #fiya

And the COLESLAW aka "Pickled Cabbage"?
Fahgettaboudit. Dope af.

The registers you peep to the right as you walk in are for takeout only; wait at the threshold for dine-in. Guess how I found that out, lol.

"I'll be back."
author: Dan B.

description:
Hummus is often relegated as a grocery store side, so it's nice to see it star as the main dish.  With an extremely hummus (and adjacent dips) centric menu, it's quite apparent what you need to order.  I opted for the main entree plate of hummus since it seemed more novel than a sandwich or a dip.  The main entree plate is indeed a great way to break hummus stereotypes.

Pickled Cabbage: Comes for free at the table.  Was hoping this would either taste like kimchi or like sauerkraut.  Unfortunately, it tasted like wilted coleslaw.  Not a huge fan, though it was useful to cleanse the tahini off the palate between hummus bites.

Hummus Lamb: This was simply delicious.  I'm not a huge fan of refrigerator-cold hummus, which is all too common in the U.S.  Something about this warm fluffy hummus just rocked my world.  The lamb chunks were tender and full of flavor, a perfect complement to the mellow pureed chickpeas.  Even better when scooped on some pita bread and topped with green harissa.

Pitas: These are definitely *not* those sorry pita frisbees you get from a bag.  They were super fluffy, but you can still split them in the middle.  Nice and sturdy for getting a lot of hummus on to each torn off piece.

Falafels: Tiny, yet delicious.  Perfectly crunchy exterior with soft and grainy inside.  Why not eat chickpeas with your chickpeas?

Lemonade: Probably the only truly disappointing item I paid for.  It was overly tart with way too much ice.  Felt like the drink was gone after only a few sips.  Could use more sugar and less ice.
author: Adam B.

description:
I've never been a huge hummus fan. Didn't hate it, just didn't see why everyone seems to love it. But a few weeks ago a coworker of mine was eating hummus for lunch and insisted I try it. It was the best I'd ever had and the bread was so soft and delicious -- I needed to know where this delicious hummus was from, and she said Oren's.

Luckily that wasn't too long before Oren's finally opened in San Francisco, so I didn't have much of a wait before I got to have some of that hummus again. Oren's is both a sit down and take out restaurant, so you can either walk into the side entrance to grab some food to-go or head into the main entrance to eat at the restaurant.

The restaurant was pretty packed on a Thursday night after 6 but we were seated right away. Our waiter was extremely friendly and took the time to explain how the menu worked and recommended a couple of dishes. We went with the classic hummus ($8.95), chicken pita sandwich ($12.95), fries ($4.95), and babaganoush.

Service was pretty slow. The servers seemed to be focusing the majority of their attention on a large party in the middle of the restaurant, which was putting a strain on their ability to serve everyone else. But because they'd only been open a couple weeks when I was there, a manager was walking around and asking every table how their evening was going, to get a feel for any service kinks that needed to be ironed out.

When the food finally came I was wowed by the portion sizes but even more so by how delicious everything was. I already knew the classic hummus was great but there's nothing like having it with fresh-from-the-oven pita bread. (Every extra piece is .80 cents but each "piece" is a whole pita.) The chicken pita sandwich was the highlight of the meal for me: grilled chicken, hummus, cucumber, tomatoes, pickles, and tahini. Everything came together in an amazing mix of flavors, the pita was stuffed, and even though I shared the sandwich with my boyfriend I secretly wanted to eat the whole thing myself because it was so good. The fries were really good, steak cut, and served in a very generous portion. I'm not a babaganoush fan but my boyfriend loved it.

We were left with some hearty leftovers after the meal and figured that the next time we go, we'd be good just ordering the classic hummus and one other dish, rather than the sides we also ordered. Other than the slow service, all of the food here was delicious, portions were large, and the servers were all very friendly. Will definitely be back.
author: Angela M.

description:
Nice breakfast bread plate. All fresh bread. Like the Israeli breakfast a lot in that regard. Nice two courses.

Their pita and hummus is of course good as well. Love how fluffy the hummus is and the pita fresh is awesome.

As with Oren's, service/ consistency is just okay. 

Vibes are much better than  Palo Alto location. 

Can recommend!
author: Aakash G.

description:
Came here for opening day lunch with my team!  We really liked the restaurant, very clean and polite servers. 

We ordered the sampler plate, the cauliflower hummus and the Israeli salad with chicken on top.

We had a really nice variety of dips and the pita's were huge!  The hummus was great and the salad was yummy.  

The manager (I think his name was Natan) came over to our table to check on us and was a really friendly and happy guy.

My coworkers and I are excited to try the to-go option for quick lunches as well.
author: Kimberly L.

description:
I got the falafel rice bowl, not a fan. It was just a bowl of rice some tomatoes and falafel balls. No sauces or other veggies. The rice was not good at all, and my falafel balls tasted burned.

I was willing to give this place a second chance, wanted to try a sandwich, BUT I also ordered a small side of hummus... they were not kidding when they said small* see picture* and it wasn't even full for $6..... SIX. Honesty, how do you even justify that price. I will say the hummus was good but a tablespoon for $6 not worth it.  

You'd be better off going to Saffron 685 on Townsend.
author: Nicki B.

description:
The food - 4/5
The service - 2/5

Oren's has been a staple go-to for me since my Stanford days. It's home. It's delicious. The SF location is just as amazing as the Palo Alto one. 

The food - The hummus is fluffy AF and the sides were consistently great (looking at you Moroccan carrots), but unfortunately, the shakshuka came out on the lukewarm side and sweeter than normal (like tomato candy). A solid meal, with some room for execution improvements. 

The service - During our hour long meal, my party and I (of 4 total) were waited on, almost too attentively. Extra attention in and of itself is fine, but not so great when we felt pressured with upsell. After ordering what was sufficient enough food and confirming so, the server stayed to insist that we order more sides. Or the falafels. Or more pita. Or more pita again. Or dessert. Are you sure? This one *points* is great...I get it. 

Oren's is AMAZING, and we all laughed this experience off. But I'm not going to lie, it was a bit much on the enthusiasm and upsell.
author: Christine J.

description:
My friends and I came here for dinner and I decided to get the beef keebab, which came with two sides, of which I chose hummus and babaganoush. They meal comes with a small cole-slaw like salad at the beginning which was delicious.

I loved both the hummus and the babaganoush. The hummus was rich flavored, creamy and overall very pleasant. The babaganoush had a garlicky taste that went really well with the eggplant, and served as a nice counterbalance to the hummus.

The rest of the food though was quite disappointing. The beef kebabs were really dry, and kind of hard in places. It no longer had that nice juicy taste I usually expect from the kebabs, it was just dry. The pita bread was okay, it was warm but it was missing a nice soft fluffy texture.

Overall an okay choice, and decently priced, but not my favorite place for hummus and pita bread.
author: Tyler T.

description:
I have been a large fan of Oren's since I went to the first shop in Palo Alto a few summers ago. When I saw it was coming to SF, I made sure to get in there early. 

I had a more than enjoyable dine in experience. They bring out a complimentary little salad plate. Then the hummus tasted just as fresh as I remember it! My waiter recommended the Oren's eggplant, and when I told him I didn't like it because it was too oily, he promptly replaced my side with the tomato/cucumber salad! Light and refreshing. 

Not going the lie, the whole wheat pita was just eh, so maybe it's worth the slightly less-healthy plain pita for a better experience. Overall, look forward to going back!
author: Kyle S.

description: Came here during lunch with my husband and OMG the flavors just blew our minds. We ordered chicken skewer and 2 hummus bowls. Best flavors I've tested in a long time. I've been to Israel and traveled around there and the flavors are genuine , fresh and new. Was happy to find something near my office because I'm a huge foodie and love trying new things. I'd recommend this place to everyone wanting to try new fresh flavors.
author: Konstancia M.

description:
Fancy Mediterranean restaurant located in downtown SF. Came here with a couple friends for an early Friday dinner.

First came a complimentary salad for everyone, which was quite a refreshing start to the meal. We then ordered a couple things to share family style. 

We ordered 6 bourekas: 3 mushroom and 3 potatoes. These were small pastries with some filling inside. The pastry itself was perfect -- quite flaky and buttery. The mushroom filling was quite unique and interesting, and the potato one provided a good hearty taste.

Next for the hummus, we ordered a side of babaganoush eggplant hummus, as well as the lamb hummus bowl. This came with some pita bread for the table. The pita was incredibly fresh, warm, and huge, so you can just dip whatever you want on it. I personally didn't like the baganoush eggplant that much -- had a strange peculiar taste that I wasn't used to. The lamb hummus was OK, though I wish there was a bit more meat for the dish.

We also got the shakshuka, which was quite underwhelming and not worth it for the price, as it was basically tomato sauce and eggs. It also didn't seem to go that well with pita, in my opinion. 

We got the rice bowl as well with falafels, which was definitely the highlight. The basmatic rice was very flavorful and falafels were perfect.

Because we were lacking meat, we also got an ala carte beef skewer to share. This was quite small for the price but the beef was very juicy.

Overall, there were some ups and downs in the meal, but the service was great and I would come back again to figure out what is best on the menu.
author: Alvin W.

description:
What's the deal about hummus?? Right??! Wrong! Oren's hummus is all about fresh, fancy hummus with yummy toppings!! 

We got three hummus plates between 5 of us and that was plenty! Large quantities of hummus and freshly baked pita! What's to not like! We got the cauliflower, eggplant and lamb toppings! Cauliflower was my favorite!!

We also got some of their phyllo and it was really good!

Overall, Oren's hummus is what you expect; classic hummus with some interesting toppings; no fusion and all that! I'm all for safe places.. 5 stars!
author: Divya S.

description:
The wait is sooo worth it! I have been waiting for Oren Hummus to open in San Francisco for so long, and let me tell you, it was worth the wait!
Great food, great service! a little on the pricey side but the food is so amazing.

so many options for vegetarians as well as the carnivores among us :-)
the best Pita you'll have aside for Frena Bakery on 6th and mission.
author: Guy L.

description:
I would give this Oren's location in San Francisco zero stars if I could. While I have never stepped foot inside the physical restaurant, I have ordered from them through Caviar six times. On all but one occasion, they have made major mistakes when completing my order. 

Today was the absolute last straw, as it was the most unprofessional and unacceptable delivery experience I have ever had by far. 

Here's what I ordered: two orders of hummus, two orders of falafel, and four red sauces on the side. Here's what I received: ONE order of falafel, ONE order of hummus, and ZERO red sauces. The missing items alone were bad enough, especially because it's a recurring theme with them, but that wasn't even close to the worst part.

The real issue was this: The hummus they delivered was PACKAGED, as in, the way you would buy it from a supermarket. AND IT HAD AN EXPIRATION DATE STICKER LISTING TOMORROW'S DATE (see attached image). It legitimately appears as if an employee decided that it was a good idea to send a paying delivery customer their oldest, expiring, packaged hummus because they didn't want to have to throw it away. Never in my life have I experienced a more wretched example of "food service."

And like I said initially, they've royally screwed up all but one of my six orders. On July 21, I only received one order of hummus when I ordered two. On July 22, the order took over two hours to be delivered and the $7 sweet potato fries "with red pepper mayo" that I ordered didn't come with red pepper mayo. On July 29, I only received one order of falafel when I ordered two. On August 24, the $7 sweet potato fries "with red pepper mayo" didn't come with any red pepper mayo again, and there was only one red sauce when I explicitly requested four. (On August 10, by some miracle it seems, they actually got my order right.)

I have tried to give this restaurant a fair shake. I have been a loyal Oren's customer since they opened their doors in downtown Palo Alto many years ago. That location, in person and through Caviar, has always served me well and never let me down. 

I never write bad reviews on Yelp. I never call restaurants to complain. But my experience with this Oren's location in San Francisco has been so atrocious that I felt it my duty to do both. The employee and manager I spoke to on the phone were nice enough, but it's too late for apologies. I will never order from them again, and I suggest you avoid them as well.

Oren's is pretty tasty, but it is absolutely not worth the headache if ordering delivery from the San Francisco location. They have permanently lost my business and I will be telling anyone who will listen not to go there or order from them.

Extra note: I just remembered that about four of the six times I ordered from here, the falafel was cold and tasted stale.
author: Ben K.

description:
Here's a hint - don't come here if you aren't a fan of hummus!!

That being said, this place does hummus really REALLY well and their pita bread is not bad either!! For any of the hummus bowls, its literally a giant bowl of hummus with a scoop of topping in the middle. In my case, they were mushrooms..in my friends case, it was chicken liver. Both were good, but felt they could've been a little more generous with my mushrooms..i mean..$20 for hummus and tiny scoop of mushroom? Shrugs. Guess that's SF for you!

Beautiful ambiance,  I love the giant chandelier and the wood accents everywhere! The space is classy without being pretentious. Has a decent selection of beer and wine and maybe three salad options. No wait, but super crackin for a Thursday night after work!  Next time, I'm going to go for the white pita bread, the wheat one was a bit coarser and grainy...go for the white!! Will definitely be back next time i'm going for something light..
author: Jennifer S.

description:
Came here for some hummus to go (they have a separate section just for to go). That's definitely the right approach here. Obviously what they do really well here is the hummus.

I got the lamb hummus, and I was surprised the lamb was in the style of pulled pork. It makes sense since it's easier to stuff into your pita and consume that way. 

An order of hummus gives you two pita breads and some hummus. The hummus I thought was good and the pita comes in two options (white or wheat). I had both and thought both were good. I'm not very picky for my hummus/pita though.

The lamb...very small portion. And after I finished this, I realized I was hungry still. I wouldn't consider ordering one hummus as a meal.
author: Victor D.

description:
This is the best fast casual middle eastern food you can get this side of the Atlantic. The hummus bowl with lamb actually caused my jaw to drop the other night, and the eggplant dip trio, labne, Israeli pickles and slaw are reminiscent of my time in Israel and on par with the real deal. 

All of the food is great for sharing, and there wasn't a single thing I tried that I wouldn't order again. Standout was the Oren's eggplant dip and the lamb hummus with gluten free pita. Love.
author: Lauren M.

description: Food is tasty and comes out quickly. Very good service. There's a wait at lunch time  the hummus is super rich and not acidic - lots of tahini! The mint lemonade is refreshing and not to sweet. Fresh pita. Save room for some desserts!
author: Weich Y.

description:
While the food never disappoints, 4/6 of my last visits have had some mix of food delivery issues (order mixed up, 15 m. late delivery on an order placed 24 hours in advance, 1 hour dine-in time from order to food). Manager Gaetano (apologies if I butchered that) was very gracious and receptive to feedback, and I'm optimistic about service improvements soon (still optimistic as of 8/20, last issue).

FOOD:
Oren's is the Bay Area champ of hummus--it's rich-tasting without overwhelming the palate, incomparably smooth, and Oren's signage would suggest it's lower in Calories than standard hummus as well (idk and idc, really). I don't love that sugar is added to nearly every non-hummus dish (perhaps the hummus too)

Be warned--green hot sauce is HOT. Red is milder (~Israeli chipotle pepper?) and for those with medium+ spice tolerance can be generously poured over any entree.

- Pita is generally fluffy (2x it was slightly stale on 1/4 of the border) and always warm--I love the feeling of ripping apart a pita here! It's a lovely balance of dense (filling!) and soft with beautifully sized yeast bubbles.

- Hummus cauliflower: Hummus base topped with cauliflower and golden raisins--a tad sweet for my tastes, but a fun and tasty combo

- Hummus eggplant: Hummus base topped with roasted eggplant, cauliflower, and garlic. MY FAVORITE! Again, the roasted eggplant is a tad sweet

- Veggie skewer: Be warned that veggies are a little greasy from the grill, so if you were ordering the veggies for "clean eating," this is not the answer. That said, it's nice to have some vitamins in there and have the choice of two sides (whoo!). Only sad part for me is the single pita included (v. two with the hummus bowls)

- Marinated beets: Beet are chopped finely and tossed in a vinaigrette--a bit too sour for me when I'm looking to experience the natural sweetness of beetness :)

- Hummus lamb: the pomegranate marinade was a bit overwhelming and drowned out the more subtle flavors of the lamb. Enjoyable still, but I wouldn't order again

- Flash-fried cauliflower--expectedly greasy, but as clean as it gets with flash-fried (Shishito level grease). Fun!

- Classic Shakshouka--this was overwhelmingly sweet and neither of us wanted to finish it--would recommend toning down the sweetness or switching tomatoes (if canned) to let more of the tomatoes' natural flavors sing in the dish. 

SERVICE: For to go orders, online ordering makes it easy! Service is exceedingly friendly, but I've had issues 3/5 visits here (forgotten or swapped items in to go orders)--do a quick check before you leave the store. 

In store, there was a "computer issue" during opening week that resulted in us sitting without food for 1.5 hours. While this was a pretty unacceptable situation, all staff were incredibly apologetic. 

AMBIANCE: Separate dine-in and to-go storefronts (connected within though) preserve the charm of the dine-in area. Great for a quick weekday lunch or a languorous Sunday brunch :). 

Dine-in: while it's a casual eatery, I appreciate the small touches that make this feel more upscale--booths, reasonably spaced tables (for SF), and decor make it a place I'd enjoy going on a date (given how excellent the food is :)). Rich in succulents and shiny objects (mirrors, large & slightly gaudy chandelier), inside there's plenty to look at if eye contact isn't what you're looking for :). Dine-in menu includes more meat and special entrees, as well as "Israeli favorites" (e.g., shakshouka). SF is the only location with breakfast, so give it a try if you're in town!

To go: Order ahead online from Oren's site or walk in for some grab and go options! Within the store or online, one can order all the sandwich, hummus bowl, skewer, and salad options. Given past order issues with 1-20 items, I would suggest you count everything before you leave lest you have to return. 

There's a cold case on the right with pre-packaged sides you can grab if in a hurry or for a group meal in a pinch. Buy 3 sides, get one free! I don't think you can go wrong with anything in the case :).
author: Helen W.

description:
Amazing service and food! I will definitely come back. Amit is also very sweet and a great waiter. 

Highly recommend!
author: alessa b.

description:
Rediculous how long the wait is to place an order at the ToGo.  Unbelievable that at the lunch rush one woman is working the cashier and also doing other things.   And barely anyone is waiting for an order.   And i spend 13 for a sandwich?   Use both cash registers or do online ordering! Never coming here again.  

6 people ahead of me and I waited 14 minutes in line.  That's why you shouldn't go here
author: David S.

description: I'm happy that there's an Oren's Hummus in SF now! All the Oren's have such nice and classy decor. You can choose to either sit down and eat or order food to go (there's a register for that on the right side of the restaurant). I always get the chicken schnitzel pita sandwich which usually fills me up. Pretty pricey, but you definitely get great service and good quality pita / hummus!
author: Annie S.

description:
This is one of my favorite places to eat. I have been to their different locations multiple times and I must say, I have never ever been disappointed. Their beef hummus is to die for, like you gotta gotta gotta have it and for all my vegetarian friends, the chickpea hummus is good too, so you are covered. 

Their rice bowl is of a huge quantity and something I always order. 
Also, I would say if you are going out with a vegetarian friend or if you feel like order the sampler , it has everything veg and everything is worth it. 

This place is simply amazing. I love the staff, I love the food, I love that it's not complicated here and I am actually salivating as I am writing this review. Go grab some hummus and pita!!
author: Ramyata M.

description:
Fun, new place in SOMA.  I don't think it will be a place you will go to eat a few times a month, maybe more of a once every three months.  The food is fresh, and a great atmosphere.  I think they are still a little new and are working on service, not the best.  I did enjoy the Hummus.  I ordered the sampler, but they picked the flavor, no substitute, so I don't think I'd order that again.  Only really liked two of the three, so it's better to order separately.  I had the Chicken Pita sandwich, fresh ingredients, good size pita but a very small portion of flavorless chicken.  
Overall it is a place I'd eat again, but probably not in the near future.
They do have a grab and go area that you can get hummus to go.  You can pick the flavor you enjoy.
author: David E.

description:
Stopped into Oren's last week for takeout.  I am very familiar with this place from eating at their flagship Palo Alto location many a time. I was shocked at the quality of the food at the SF location.  Husband's Sabich was chock full of mushy eggplant- not the charred fried version at the other location. My falafel side was soggy and undercooked, they gave us the wrong tabouleh (we wanted the "untraditional") and further - while the hummus with eggplant was ok, THEY FORGOT TO GIVE US PITA. I mean, what is the point even.

It's only been a week or so since they've opened so I cut them some slack but I hope they get their shit together soon.  This location is lightyears away from matching the Palo Alto one.
author: Archana P.

description:
This place is da bomb. I've been a fan since I visited their Palo Alto and Mountain View restaurant years ago and couldn't wait to visit once I heard they were opening up 2 blocks from my work place in San Francisco. 

I got the Chicken Schnitzel pita sandwich the first time round and the mushroom hummus bowl the second time. The food was great, as is always the case with Orens. I'm waiting to go back the third and the fourth and the fifth time so that I can try all the other items on the menu (Chicken skewers, the rice bowl etc.)

If you're in the neighborhood, just go to Orens. Don't think.
author: Gaurav K.

description:
Loved it.
Excellent breakfast/lunch/dinner/weekend option near the office!
Really fresh hummus with a variety of interesting toppings, very creamy labneh, really soft giant pita.. everything was excellent!
I also tried this tiny potato-filled pie they have on the menu called a Boureka.. loved it.
Super enthusiastic staff, fast free wifi.
Warning: The dips available on every table are really really spicy.. don't eat a giant spoonful of it like I did :'(
author: Aditya M.

description: I love Oren's Hummus! So so pumped a location opened in SF because the Palo Alto one is so so good. This location is beautiful and huge! I really loved the vibes and the food.
author: Tina L.

description: Delicious food, great service, CLEAN restaurant and bathrooms, nice ambience with cool decorations, our waiter "Amit" was awesome--so nice, knowledgeable about the food, professional, we loved him! We loved everything about this place! Highly recommend!!!!
author: P M.

description: Went here for lunch. We ordered French toast, Hummus beef and Falafel. The foods were ok. The reason I gave one star because the waitress messed up my bill with the lady who sat two table across my table. I noticed that instead of charging for $38.10 which was our bill, they charged me two different amount on my credit card. They charged $19.05 (the amount that I divided with my friend since we used two credit cards to pay) and $31.56 ( the lady bills) on my credit card. I am so upset right now since I have to call my bank and notified them. This is really annoying since it's wasting my time. I would not want to come back here again. This is my first time experience the restaurant that charged me twice. Too much work to deal with this problem. Don't wanna experience this ever again.
author: San L.

description: AMAZING! Great hummus and food :) like in Israel  worth to visit and try the delicious food! Can't wait to come back w all my friends. Cheers
author: Nadav C.

description:
Food was delicious but the wait time for to go was too long. we had to wait for almost 25 mins before we got the boxes

If they improve the wait time then I will definitely visit again
author: Prashanth B.

description: Fantastic Middle Eastern food. Everything we ordered was delicious!  Great service too.
author: Sonya A.

description:
Attending a conference and went here with 5 colleagues.  The sampler platter is an awesome app!  The strained yogurt, on a pita, with a marinated beet and carrot is a good flavor mix.

I got the beef skewer entree, with hummus and pickles/olives as my two sides.  The beef skewer was delicious and the sauce it came with bonkers good!  The hummus was a little bland, for my taste.

We also had to wait for our server to arrive but the manager took care of us while we waited - so, we weren't negatively impacted.

Nice atmosphere and food, a great lunch spot by the convention center!
author: Meredith M.

description:
Came here because it was conveniently right across the street from the Park Central Hotel where I was staying. 

The restaurant is really beautifully decorated, with a classy ambience and a smaller/cozier space than the Cupertino location. Right away, we were seated by the manager and our drink orders were taken. Our server was extremely nice and gave me a few recommendations when I asked for them. Both she and the manager kept coming back to check up on us and make sure we were enjoying everything. My friend and I weren't that hungry, so our main priority was just to get something small to fill our stomachs but I ended up ordering an entree and it was really good! I really like this place as the location was convenient for us, and the service was amazing.
author: Egg C.

description:
I'm so excited that Oren's has made it to the city! I used to go to Oren's all the time in Palo Alto since it was near my work and was convenient to the train station. I LOVE their hummus, pita, and babaganoush. 

I enjoy all of the dishes but my go to are the chicken and beef skewers. Wishing they expand to east bay soon!
author: Julian Y.

description: Loved the taste. This was my first visit so I decided to try falafel sandwich. Man that's probably the best falafel I have ever tried. Crunchy top and super soft inside. I am definitely a fan, if you are reading this review right now, imagine the best falafel you have ever tasted, Oren's is better than that.
author: Qasim Z.

description:
Wow!!!!

Listen up boys and girls.
This place make me want to move to San Francisco.
The food is A M A Z I N G
service is great, love the atmosphere, love the people.
No seriously.
I'm coming back tomorrow and bringing my friends.
The only bad thing about this place is that it's about 350 miles from my house in LA, so now I have to figure out how to fit this into my next trip here.
If I could give them 7 stars I would
author: Moshe L.

description: I love this place. Their food & ambiance is great if you are looking for a casual place. Their hummus and meats compliment each other so well & I love their Israeli salad! Their chicken skewer & hummus with beef bowl are my go to!!!
author: Anna T.

description: Great environment and service. The decor is quite beautiful. The staff very friendly. And the food was very delicious. I had the hummus mushrooms, a side of falafels and a mint tea. All very good. The surprise was the mint tea which was mint leaves in hot water. So refreshing! And all very affordable. Will definitely come back.
author: Kay O.

description:
The freshest food I've tasted in so long. We started with the lamb hummus and carrot/orange juice 50/50. 

The pita is soft and very tasty. The hummus is filled with flavor. 

We haven't even got our entrees and this is immediately 5* for me.
author: V M.

description: I believe it was chicken kabaab with rice.  The chicken quality was poor, very chewy, lots of fat. The taste of all the dishes was bland.  But like I said, the service and friendliness of the staff was great.
author: S. B.

description: The food is tasty. It's worth the stop for sure. Haven't eaten there, but their takeout service is pretty great. That said, they're still trying to work out the kinks and service is pretty slow and scattered. So be willing to invest some time.
author: Stacy T.

description: Great place for Israeli/Middle Eastern food.  It is large, clean, attractively decorated.  The service was terrific.  We had the beef kabobs, which were excellent.  Very well spiced and not over cooked.  We tried the Moroccan carrots, Israeli salad, beets and tabbouleh as sides, along with some Jaffa hummus.  Just the smell made us feel like we were there.  The pickled cabbage which comes as an appetizer was a little bland, but that was the only thing that was off.  We will head here anytime we are near by.
author: Michael W.

description:
The food is so good! I got the beef sandwhich and it was amazing! Their hummus plate was also very good. The pita was soft and warm and the hummus was obviously fresh.  

The restaurant is clean and waitresses/waiters are friendly! I highly recommend this place.
author: Nepheli A.

description: Did a quick take out at Oren's Hummus. The falafel sandwich was great. Sweet potatoes fries were okay but the accompanying sauce/spicy mayo was amazing. Would highly recommend to try it more. Food was definitely tasty but not sure if the serving portion was worth it. Would recommend for great tasting food.
author: Nilesh C.

description:
My new favorite place! The hummus is to die for! I haven't had the bowls, but the sandwiches are amazing.   They are pretty big and filling! I always order to go and it only takes them 5 minutes.  I haven't actually sat at the restaurant yet! 
Highly recommend!
author: E A.

description: Cool spot on 3rd street. It was a bit of hummus overload for me, but I really appreciate what they're trying to do by classing it up. The bread was great of course, but I don't think I ate as much hummus in one sitting before. Certain meat dishes are pre-integrated with onions, which is horrendous for me. Got some kind of shredded beef with rich, semi-sweet flavors. It was interesting, but not my cup of tea.
author: Young Y.

description:
Seriously these guys just have absolutely no idea what they're doing. The incompetence of the floor staff is appalling. We have been here and they told us the wait is 45 minutes but there is no one in line ahead of us and there is no one waiting either. Also they ran out of glasses? I thought she was kidding when she said that they don't have enough water glasses. 

Also the floor staff doesn't know how to seat people. The food was Ok as I felt that everything lacked salt and flavor. Their Mountain View and Palo Alto locations are way better. 

I think they really do need to work on getting the kinks out. I don't experience such incompetence at most new restaurants as we saw at Orens in SF.
author: Rohan D.

description:
We had a fantastic breakfast here. I had the Green Shaksuka, which was very very tasty. Plus the red sauce on the table and it was something I'll want again. I meant to add sausage, but forgot. (To be honest, it was plenty of food without the sausage.) My husband had the Challah French Toast, plus a side of scrambled egg, which he spiced up with the green sauce. 

Usually, when we eat brunch in San Francisco, we have to be sure to go on a hike or something to work it off. Today, we both feel satisfied but not overfull. Also, since it hasn't been discovered as a brunch spot yet, we didn't have to wait, which was nice.

We'll definitely return and probably on a more regular basis than other brunch spots.
author: Melissa R.

description: The best ready made hummus I've had since getting back from the Middle East.  The pre-packaged stuff at the grocery stores is just plain wrong.  This place does it right!!!
author: Hera D.

description: Perfection!! Will write more details later. I will take the BART downtown, to go to this place!
author: Scott N.

description: Delicious food. Amazing variety of hummuses and sides. You don't feel guilty about eating here, because food is always fresh and I would call it a healthy choice. The place is fairly new and has beautiful interior design.
author: Iryna P.

description: Our first visit was last night (Saturday, October 13th) and loved the choices on the menu, the ambiance of the room and the friendly service.  The food that we all ordered for the three of us was excellent - so why not a five star?  Maybe we are in the minority here but simply because of the loud music blaring from the speakers above us! - the music was so distracting that we could not fully enjoy all the good things we were experiencing.  There was one a point the music choices sounded like we were in a dance club at a decibel that was so loud that our group found our selves shouting to each other to carry on a conversation.  Suggesting that the volume of the music is adjusted one or two notches.  Not sure if we will be returning which is a shame because we did love everything else about the restaurant!
author: Rick E.

description:
I was super excited to try this place but was very disappointed with both food and service. Hummus was just okay and the pita was way too fluffy.
Our waiter Max doesn't know what he was doing. Took him forever to get us water and I clearly said WHITE pita and he brings wheat. I told him I ordered white and he acts like it was my mistake. He even looked at his notes. He can't even write down the order correctly. 
Then he brings me the white pita and tells me this was not his mistake so I called him out on it and then he suddenly saids I'm right. Huh?????
Wow.  He doesn't know how to treat his customers and can't believe he wouldn't admit to his mistake. Even my friend said you ordered white and not wheat. Terrible service.
author: Ema I.

description: Great service, the gluten free pita here is nice and fluffy. I just spent a month in the Middle East where they don't make gluten free pita... Oren's needs to send someone over their the recipe!
author: Andrea C.

description:
I'm a fan. I am a guy who typically does not eat this type of food. But I can get use to this. 

I ordered one of the Hummus bowls. The biggest issue I have which is a deal breaker; is that you will produce an amazing amount of flatulence. I would not eat here again during my lunch period. The amount of times I had to step out of the office to let some air out was ridiculous.
author: HonestOpino N.

description:
They are still figuring things out. Can't speak for the hummus, but having a 20 minute waitlist for a party of 1 when I counted 10 open 2-tops is kinda crazy. Oh well.

UPDATED AFTER DINNER:
30 minutes after giving my number, without getting the notification text that my table was ready, I walked over annoyed. I was told immediately that there was a seat, which ended up being one of the original open tables.
I ordered the Sabik and a beer, was happy with the food. Unfortunately my experience is colored by the poor introduction to the restaurant.
author: Jared B.

description:
Stupid staff - had to wait for over 10 minutes during my lunch break for them to find out they had no tables available, and the wait time was 30 minutes!!
Completely unprepared for busy lunch hours in downtown and don't accept reservations for parties of less than 6.
author: Anton T.

description: Amazing food!!!! Definitely would be back. Convenient location to the convention center and also timing was helpful for lunch on a tight schedule. Some of the best shashuka ive ever had..
author: Jamie S.

description: This is the 4th time I've eaten here. First 3 times were excellent. Just ordered same plate (lamb hummus) because  the first few times it was awesome. This time the lamb was cold and chewy and it didn't have the olive oil or same taste.  Must be a different chef. Disappointed. Maybe quality is also different for take out.
author: Jeremy G.

description:
At present, somewhat comically poorly run, but a solid choice in the area since they're open on weekends and evenings in an area otherwise poorly served outside the M-F business hours.

I've been here three times and two of the three times the food arrived cold (cold bourekas, very cold chicken skewer). I think once they figure out the staff and kitchen handoff, they'll be good.

On the plus side, the hummus is solid and you get a complementary consolation marinated cabbage.
author: Vlad S.

description: "Nifla!"  Hummus and babaganoush like the kind I grew up with.  Pita was fresh and warm, and even the whole wheat pita was delicious.  I also recommend the 50/50 orange/carrot juice.  Go.  Now.
author: Michelle B.

description:
I like hummus. But I'm not sure I want to eat a whole meal of mostly hummus. I got the hummus bowl with beets, which comes with hummus, 2 pieces of pita bread, a tiny portion of salad, and 2 extra sauces.

The pita was nice and warm and soft and very good. The hummus had added beets and nuts, which I do think enhanced the taste and provided contrast in texture. The salad was pickled and also complements the hummus and bread.

Overall everything was good and nicely balanced, but I just felt like I needed a main dish. Also there wasn't enough bread for the amount of hummus -- a third piece of pita would have been perfect.

Not sure what else I was expecting from a place called HUMMUS, but I guess this just isn't my thing. The hummus was good though, and I would recommend it to people looking for hummus main dishes.
author: Posu Y.

description:
Great selections for lunch, if you don't mind a short wait. They also have a grab and go section if you're short on time with plentiful options. 

Friendly staff, tasty Israeli salad (recommend adding chicken!), fries and make sure you get the dips! Favorites include the labneh & Oren's hummus. Warning: portions are huge, so come hungry. 

Really reasonably priced and I'm glad there's finally an SF location!
author: Tammy H.

description:
My experience is purely based on delivery orders from caviar. Real talk - I do love their food a ton. The hummus is amazing and the grilled items taste fabulous. It's why after many bad experiences I have continued to keep trying and hope they can get their takeout/delivery act together. I don't think I can do it anymore though.

The first time I ordered, they forgot my side of chicken and feta cheese. No big deal - people make mistakes. Caviar refunded the items. 

The second time I ordered, they forgot my wife's meal all together. Again, people make mistakes and caviar promptly refunded. 

Third time I ordered, everything was correct. Great. We are finally going in the right direction for this great, great hummus!

Fourth time, I received someone else's order and it was completely different from mine. 


Sadly, the fourth will be the last time I order from them. I dig the hummus but I also like receiving the correct items.
author: Matt D.

description: This place is amazing! Everything we tried was so delicious. We ordered falafel ( my husband is not a big fan of falafels and he loved it! ), it was sift inside and crispy outside, beet hummus with pita, labneh and one of each boureks. I tried an Israeli beer, loved it! Unfortunately we were so full, couldn't try deserts. One more reason to come back.
author: Timi B.

description:
It's taken over half an hour to get a pita sandwich. I still haven't gotten it yet. Unless you enjoy waiting in a cramped store front, you should probably go somewhere else.
Update: took around 45 minutes to get my order.  The sandwich was mostly hummus with a few pieces of beef and the garnishees.  For $14, there are better choices in the area.
author: Chris M.

description:
I am very disappointed in this restaurant .   My friend ordered a pita sandwich without potatoes.   But of course a mouthful of potatoes later... then the manager comes and tell us they will not make
Another sandwich without the potatoes because it is obviously our fault there was a communication problem.  Never will I come again
author: Mill K.

description: Delicious food, beautiful restaurant, polite and attentive staff. I ordered the lemonade with mint, original hummus appetizer, and the chicken skewer entree (with cauliflower and Israeli salad as my sides). A lot of food and so worth it!
author: Deema A.

description: Went with friends for dinner.  The food was very delicious and flavorful. Recommend getting the dip/side dish sampler. Their 2 condiment hot sauces are not as hot as lead on to believe, but it might be that I can take heat more than most people. The green harissa hot sauce is my favorite; had some heat & slight tang; my friend almost ate half of the jar.  Wait staff was attentive without being overly so, thus allowing my friends and I to enjoy our meal and conversations.  Would recommend & go again.
author: Yolie K C.

description: Chicken skewers was excellent. The house (plain) hummus is very plain... what was awesome was the Hummus Sabich!! Overall I would have given 5 star but the order was a little messed up- no worries we ate around it! Bahaha
author: Tylor M.

description:
This is only meant to make sure that this location becomes as awesome as the one in Palo Alto.   

After one visit today:

The good: 
super nice and friendly staff   
really nice decor
spacious, modern bathrooms  

The bad: 
I ordered two dishes around 7 pm when it was moderately busy and it took almost an hour to get it. 
Mint lemonade was gross. It tasted diluted and this is something that can and needs to be worked out. 

While the chairs are cute and comfortable, the sofa sitting is very uncomfortable. It's impossible to sit up straight, let alone lean back. If it's under builder's warranty due to being new, I would insist that the builder fixes it and to make sure that people can actually enjoy those soft benches.   

I look forward to coming back, having a better experience and updating this review.
author: Arkady I.

description: I would give zero star if I could (in fact I opened a Yelp account just for this because their behavior was abominable). Ate here with a friend; food and service was mediocre. Gave a standard 15% tip. Lo and behold a few days later I found out on my credit card statement that they added an extra COUPLE OF BUCKS onto my total. Now a measly few bucks are nothing to make a big deal about, but I absolutely cannot tolerate this type of unethical behavior and am appalled at how dishonest this place is. If you think you deserve a larger tip then you need to EARN it or enforce an automatic gratuity of 20% on every transaction. Never coming back ever again and you bet I am going to dispute the credit card charge.
author: Rebecca Y.

description: Best Hummus. Best Lamb Schwarama I've had since Maroush/Ranoush in London. Actually one of the only truly Lamb Schwrama's you can find in the city, most of it is lamb and beef mix or just beef and most of the other places are basically that horrible ground meat generic factory farmed gyro crap. This is the real deal and they have the BEST pita, BEST hummus, and BEST Schwarama in the US I've had.
author: Daniel K.

description: We had the Jaffa Style Hummus, Hummus Cauliflower and Oren's Fatush Salad -all were excellent. The service was horrible. Fifteen minutes to ask if we wanted water? Food service was alright. When we tried to pay we waited twenty solid minutes... all the while our 3rd server ("Oh, I'm not your server now. I'll send your server over."???) kept ignoring my polite gazes w/ a smile. I kind of had to nearly trip him to get him to look at me and then he didn't actually say "Yes, I'll get your check" -he just kinda smiled and kept on his path. No one was overtly rude, just totally weird.
author: Matt C.

description:
I did a take out from there 3 times.  Every time, they forget to put the pita bread which was supposed to come with the meal!!!  

When I dined in, it was much better experience than takeout...
author: H M.
