description: Got the chicken rice bowl, and hubby got the beef humus bowl... DELICIOUS!!! The pita and the chicken was so soft it just was such a great meal! Definitely coming back here!!!
author: Sarah B.

description: Came to opening night party. Really yummy - we will be back. Love the variety of hummus and veggie dips. Great tasting and quality ingredients. The lamb kabob was excellently seasoned with a nice variety of side salads to dress it up. And really delicious desserts.
author: Jessica V.

description: Absolutely love this place. Interior is beautiful and staff are great! Love the beef and lamb hummus! The chicken is to die for! It simply melts in your mouth! Been here twice and experienced the same great customer service and excellent food quality!
author: Imran M.

description: I feel bad for writing this review. I came on Sunday at around 4pm. My girlfriend and I were hyped to try this place out, especially with all our friends saying great things. The one-star review comes from the absolute horrendous service. We waited 20 minutes after we were seated at our table before we got up and walked out of the restaurant. We didn't have a server even acknowledge that we were there, no drink order submitted. As an example, California Pizza Kitchen right next door, sat us and had our drink order within 2 minutes. It's sad that they didn't even get us the chance to try the food.
author: Matt N.

description: Oh my this place is incredible. Very casual feel with amazing hummus selections and the pita bread is intoxicating. Definitely returning...
author: cory h.

description: Amazing food and great price. One of the dips was so good and different than any flavor I've had I'm gonna figure it out so I can make it at home! Next time i come to SF I wanna come back so I can try more things off the menu!
author: Ginger B.

description:
Seriously the best hummus I've had. I've been wanting to go here forever. I saw that the Palo Alto location had a lot/great reviews, so I've been wanting to try it. Went there for lunch today. Everyone was super friendly. My friend and I ordered a side of small hummus with wheat pita, I had a Greek Salad with Chicken and my friend had the Chicken Pita with fries. Again, it was to die for!!

Side note: Get there early to beat the lunch rush, we got there at 11:30ish which was perfect timing, by noon there was a line out the door.
- I thought the mint lemonade was a little too sweet for me but if that's your thing then go for it.
- Managers kept walking around making sure everyone was okay, and the water was filled at all times.

Definoitely will be going back: the Hype is REAL!  =)
author: Sandy M.

description:
I fell in love with the South Bay Oren's while visiting and was excited that this location was opening while I was in SF.

I had the Hummus bowl with eggplant.  Just as good as the hummus at the other locations and still better than most hummus I try elsewhere.    The spicy red and green sauces were delicious too.

Pitas are thick - rip them to tiny pieces to scoop up the hummus.

I took mine to go and was a little worried when I saw some of the first reviews indicating a little than longer wait time.  But the counter-person told me up front that it would be a little longer and the reason why (the eggplant takes a little longer to prepare).  As long as I know the length of the wait and the why, that's good.  Looking forward to going again.

A little pricey, but you get a huge bowl of hummus, much more than at other places.
author: Joel B.

description: Food was so yummy & staff was so nice! Mayra was our server for the night & she was super attentive and helpful at recommending what to order.  Will definitely come back!
author: Aryana D.

description:
I am in the Oren's Hummus right now. I asked for a glass of water, which took them 30 min to get it. Staff does not care at all. You can see in their attitude. They don't want to listen or understand. Feel bad for the other customer next to us, who are waiting for their water. 
Good food but HORRIBLE SERVICE.
author: Rini R.

description:
This place looks amazing and the food is definitely got a great presentation to it but the taste is just okay. I got a chicken skewer and some eggplant dip with pita and I find the eggplant to be pretty bland and the same with the chicken. The pita felt chalky almost bit maybe that's the style, it looked fine on the outside. 

All that said they do have this spicy green chutney type thing on each table and it's amazing. Very fresh tasting and I'm going to try and make it at home.
author: Nick R.

description:
If you are looking for authentic middle eastern food that won't hurt your waistline, look no further. If you are vegan, vegetarian, trying to eat healthy while eating out, come here. I was fortunate enough to attend their soft opening. The owner, Oren, is a very kind man from Israel who is down to earth and passionate about bringing good food to SF. 

The restaurant had a very beautiful design, making it a pretty good option for a date night or business meal. Servers were excellent as well. 

I tried their hummus, babaganoush eggplant, romanian eggplant (basically babagnoush + red pepper), greek style eggplant, moroccan carrots, tabuleh, chunky eggplant, oren's eggplant, marinated beets.

Everything was top notch. In particular, I highly recommend the babaganoush and hummus. It was out of this world delicious. If you like dill, also try the greekstyle eggplant, my boyfriend raved about it. Can't wait to come back and try the falafel.
author: Crystal Y.

description: Food is okay but pretty pricey for such a casual place. Nothing really special about this place. I will admit that their green sauce is definitely spicy!
author: Katie S.

description: Very disappointed in my delivery today. When I go to Palo Alto I only eat at Oren's, I love their hummus, pita, and chicken. So when I learned that they were opening in SF I was very excited. Unfortunately the quality of the food just isn't the same. The pita bread isn't as good as it is at the other locations and one of the pita was so drenched in olive oil and still raw, I couldn't eat it. The hummus we received was half the size of the hummus l at the other locations. We ordered the hummus bowl (not the small side of hummus) And the chicken skewers weren't burnt :( very disappointed.
author: Jessica L.

description: Meh... had bad experiences both with takeout and dining in here. Takeout time they included bags worth of pitas (which were not that great) but forgot the actual hummus I ordered! The time I dined in, the server was very friendly, but it took 45 minutes to have food brought to our table after ordering. They definitely have some kinks to work out here.
author: Alexander C.

description:
We went here as a group of three. Once we were seated, it was about 15 minutes before anyone took our order or checked in at all. Someone else stormed out after not being served while we were waiting, but we were looking forward to the food so we waited it out. I had the lamb hummus, as did my husband, and our friend had the beef kabobs. The lamb was a lot sweeter than I expected it to be. Maybe a little too sweet. The hummus itself and the pita bread were good. Our friend seemed to enjoy the beef kabobs, too. We also ordered sodas, but got diet even though we didn't order it. 
Overall, the service was not great, and the food was mixed with some being very good and other pieces being a little off.
author: Kamden S.

description: My husband keeps raving about this place, so I decided to get lunch here one time when I was in the area. I have been here only once, but it is so worth the hype!! The classic hummus is amazing, and the pita bread just melts in your mouth! However, I will say that, personally, my ABSOLUTE FAVORITE dishes were the labane(!!!) and the falafel, and I am definitely going to come back here over and over again just for them. We also got the Israeli salad, which was super fresh and yummy. The portions are quite generous. We were two of us and ordered the small plates to try different things, and we still had a little bit of everything remaining. So glad they opened in SF!
author: Shimolee J.

description: Some of the best hummus I have had in the US. Service is friendly and the pita is delicious. The falafel was fine, but this place isn't called Oren's Falafel. Definitely going to get the hummus bowl next time. Yum! Welcome to SF Oren.
author: Jason P.

description:
I have loved Oren's until today.

All was good (Traditional Shashuka was tasty!) until we got to the Malabi. The Malabi is a delicate custard topped with raspberry syrup and pistachios pieces so much to my surprise when I bit down hard on a shell.

After digging it out of my molars, I proceeded to tell the table of 'management' staff seated behind me. The woman's response (she was conducting the meeting) - "oh that must've affected the experience." After I picked up my jaw, I alerted our waiter. His response was barely an acknowledgment and then he brought our bill. I can only gather by their nonchalant responses that this must happen a lot?! Perhaps they should include "shells" as an ingredient?

Although there was no concern from them, I did feel it my duty to provide this PSA for future patrons - eat slowly as there might be an extra, unexpected crunch.

As for me, I will stick to Trader Joe's hummus hereafter.
author: Jeanette L.

description: We were visiting San Francisco and decided to try it.  We were so impressed!  Excellent food and service.  We loved everything we had there!
author: Mark C.

description: Excellent service and amazing food. Loved the French press coffee. That was a nice surprise. Perfect location to the convention center. Food was fresh and very tasty. Can't wait to go back
author: Katherine H.

description: Happened upon this spot for lunch and fell in love. Delicious pita and hummus. My daughter, who orders Greek salads wherever we go, declared it the best she's ever had. I had the chicken pita sandwich - so good. Super filling and yummy. Nice bright decor. Great service. We'll be back.
author: Pam F.

description: Best lunch spot in San Francisco financial district. Gaetano and his team are tops! Great service, product knowledge, super friendly and make you feel right at home five stars and above
author: Henry L.

description: Came here for the Israeli breakfast and it was a fantastic spread to share with a group! I love having so many things to sample, including tiny little croissants, a mini Nutella jar, and of course plenty of breakfasty things like eggs as well as more Israeli things like pita and Israeli salad.
author: Sophia C.

description: I've been a fan of their Palo Alto location for years so I had high expectations when they opened in SF. The food is pretty good and the way they've decorated the place is pretty cool and fitting of downtown. I found the service to be very slow though given the time I visited (2pm). Other tables around me had the same comments.
author: Narek A.

description: This has quickly become a fan favourite at my office. I don't think a week has gone by yet since it's opened that I haven't heard someone or another saying they're going to eat here or pick up food from their fast food side. The food is tasty and filling and comes fairly quickly. I've been here a few times now, and I haven't been disappointed by the food (I usually order a hummus bowl, but a different one each time - for my most recent visit, I had the hummus sabich). The owner/manager (not sure which) has also come by multiple times to check on the table and make any corrections if needed. I feel inclined to mention the corrections because while the food is good and the service is friendly, they have messed up my order three times already (during different visits). Every time there was an issue, they didn't bring to the table the expected number of pita (based on the number of bowls at the table), and one time the order itself was wrong (I was brought a sandwich instead of a bowl, but that was quickly remedied and, of course, I wasn't charged for the mistake entree). Based on other reviews, it looks like these aren't isolated cases which is pretty disappointing. Since it's convenient for my office, I'd like to continue coming here regularly, but I would be hesitant to continue if these mistakes keep happening.
author: Bianca C.

description: The food is as good as the Palo Alto store, and to my surprise the restaurant was not full on a Saturday evening.
author: Yoshikage K.

description: Amazing. So glad they opened one in SF. Get the hummus bowl with lamb - incredibly savory.
author: Sonja L.

description: This new opening has a list of kinks to work out. I would wait a few months before going. Our waitress spilled water all over the floor, which is fine because it happens, but she just had someone come wipe the floor. We were all sitting there, wet, some napkins would've been useful. The food was good but they also forgot a few things we ordered so we had to ask them to take it off the bill. Overall, the experience was super disappointing.
author: Yuxuan N.

description: Amazing hummus - just like in Israel. The falafel is perfect and the chicken skewers are incredible. Try the various eggplant salads too - you won't be disappointed. If you're gluten free like my friend, the menu options are endless and I hear the gluten free pitas are top notch. The Oren Hummus team may only have one month under their belt but they are truly dedicated to making sure their customers have a delicious meal and an all around great experience.
author: M A.

description: The hummus is good, but definitely not the best hummus I've ever had, and DEFINITELY not worth the price tag. I ordered the beef hummus because the lamb hummus was $16. I swapped the pita for gluten free and the total charge was $17.50!  And they only gave me 1 little pita (maybe 4-5 inches in width) when  it advertised 2 (didn't realize until I had left). This would be a different story if the hummus came with sides, but for straight hummus and a piece of pita, not worth it.
author: Garrett W.

description:
The worst experience ever. Ordered chicken skewers but got beef. Tasted weird , thought it was minced chicken with herbs and spices but it turned out to be beef. More importantly I don't eat beef. 
Incident occurred on August 26 while dining in.
author: S D.

description: I decided to eat until overcome with numbness, so we headed out to Oren's Hummus. The eponymous menu item was incredible, I consumed all in reach that was edible. The table top sauces, red and green, were respectively nice and mean (i.e., mild and spicy, or, safe and dicey.) Although my food reviews are merely recreational, trust me, dear reader, the Greek Salad (with chicken, +$4) is sensational; though it did not come with pepperoncini, which I find a bit stingy.
author: Mike A.

description: Fantastic falafel sandwich, and loved the various eggplant dips!  The smoky Romanian one was delicious.  It's quite the happening place - busy, lively, and effervescent service.  Great place to eat as a lone diner!
author: Steven B.

description: This place exceeded our expectations!  We were just looking for a light, late dinner snack.  The hummus, pita and falafel were amazing!  The beet hummus was our favorite!  The place is brand new.  We absolutely loved the vibe and atmosphere.  We made two visits there during our stay.  Friendly service, beautiful decor and very clean!  We will definitely return!
author: Sherri W.

description:
Thank you Edwin and Antonio!
Great meal, great service and a beautiful view.
Thanks for the window seat!
author: Amy L.

description:
I ordered a sabich pita but received a beef.  It was very tasty, and different from the typical pita sandwich because (1) the pita is better and fresher tasting than other Middle Eastern to go restaurants, and (2) the accompaniments are different.  We are really lacking in good Middle Eastern food here and I hope Oren's is a sign of things to come.

As good as it was, though, the price point is what keeps this review from 4 or 5 stars.  I went with a colleague who likely makes well more than twice what I do, and he also found the prices too high.  I'm sure I'll be back, but not every week.
author: Philip L.

description: Good stuff. The hummus bowls are delicious but I can't imagine eating a whole one.. probably 18 servings of hummus in one of those. I shared it and it was great. The pita is good but would be better if wood fired. Overall great lunch option.
author: Maleea M.

description:
WoW! This is probably the best restaurant in San Fransisco ! Me and my boyfriend haven't been back home (Israel) for over a year! 
Craving to some good hummus we found Oren's Hummus Restaurant.
We couldn't believe how good the food is. The quality and the freshness of EVERYTHING blew our minds off!
  !!
author: Amber B.

description: amazing and thick hummus, good flavor and tahini served in the swoosh as God intended. The rice (that comes in the rice bowl) is super yum, cooked with tomato, garlic, and tons of spices. i had the falafel -- good texture, creamy and crunchy on the outside. tried a bit of the chicken kebab which was diviiiiiiine. and the PITA is fluffy!! and warm! and delicious. nothing like the thin dry grocery store variety.
author: Ellen G.

description: Hummus bowl with lamb and sampler of dips were delicious and plenty for 2 (with leftovers). the whole wheat pita are fluffy somehow and tasty too
author: Chris N.

description: I loved it. I've eaten here twice and am bringing my team to eat here next week for lunch. Food is fresh (and I'm a sucker for good pita) and brings together the best of Israel and other Middle Eastern countries. Service could use some work, but I think they're just new and learning :) I'd recommend.
author: Layna D.

description:
If you're thinking about trying this place because it's new to the area - do NOT do it!!   
The service is so so so slow and the people who work there don't offer any help (including the manager) or seem to care.  If the service continues to be this bad, I don't see it lasting too long.  We waited over an hour for our food - the whole time the server kept saying "did I take your order?"  Once the food came, it was not great and half of my order was missing.  I was told they'd bring the rest of it but needless to say it never came.  I left still hungry.
author: R W.

description: Very tasty!!! A lot of umami and very satisfying. I recommend the sandwiches and the Turkish coffee.
author: Olga G.

description:
Chicken rice bowl was tasty! But I did have a couple chicken bone pieces in my bowl.

Jaffa Hummus IS AWESOME

Topped with a couple walnuts. Chocolate mousse was not moussey. It looked like cold chocolate cream in a bowl with not very well whipped cream. It all tasted good but in the end I had a couple little pieces of walnut shell in mine. Not very pleasant.
author: Emily B.

description: I loved Oren's when it was in Palo Alto and I was THRILLED to hear they were expanding to SF. Delicious hummus, amazing pitas, and fabulous schnitzel. Not only is the in-person location great (our service was super personable & attentive), but they also do takeout on the various food delivery services. Great addition to the city!!
author: Margaret-Ann S.

description: They somehow missed our takeout order but were very apologetic and offered a gift card for our wait. Nice gesture and they made sure to promptly prepare our food. I've always liked Oren's in Palo Alto so I was hoping this one would live up. The pita was great, nice and warm and fluffy. Hummus was also great. Liked the rice bowls although felt they could potentially use some sauce. Overall really enjoyed my meal and will come back again soon!
author: Lisa B.

description: Nice atmosphere contemporary music good food. Server was nice and informational about the entire menu.
author: Brian H.

description: At 9:30pm the restaurant was pretty empty only 2 other parties were seated. I told the person who sat me that I was ready to order; she told me she couldn't take my order and that I'd have to wait for a server. I waited for seven minutes; a server didn't come, so I left.
author: P K.

description: Stopped in for a quick supper the other night. Ordered the Jaffra style hummus bowl and a Greek salad. The salad was nothing special. The hummus, on the other hand, was wonderful - creamy, smooth, flavorful - yummmm. And the pita was soft and substantial ... good to scoop up the hummus. I shared both with a friend and it was more than enough for supper. Plan to go back this weekend to try other items on their menu.
author: s k.

description: Great ambience and service. Delicious homus and salads, accompanied by tasty, pita bread.
author: Maria Elice P.

description: Popped in for lunch with my boys. Started with the classic hummus--delicious! Then we each had a pita sandwich: beef and falafel were both delicious. Will try to stop back before we leave San Francisco!
author: LR G.

description: Best falafel and hummus hands down!!!! Everything is amazing. We had falafel, hummus, green shakshuka (deadly good) and cauliflower. Will come back.
author: Amy H.

description: I was excited to try this casual lunch place after a nice Sunday morning spent at the SFMoMa just down the street. When we arrived, we were put on a Yelp wait list of 15.  There were multiple empty tables open, which should have been the first sign that something was wrong. We noticed that there were tons of people working, but everything still seemed frantic.  When we were finally seated, it took a 20-minutes to get our waiters attention. The waiter then messed up the order, forgot to bring us water, and didn't apologies for the inconsistent experience. The food was fine. I'd prefer if it was a order at the counter and seat yourself set up. There is really no point to have waiters at this price point.
author: K J.

description: The lamb hummus bowl was good, but I ordered pickup and they a) gave me only one pita instead of two (some disorganization I could expect since they just opened) and b) charged me 5% more than I had approved in the online order (which is sketchy).
author: Michael M.

description: Love this place... food is incredible! I visited SF and are here twice both experiences excellent. Chicken and jonas and lamb and hummus delicious.
author: John S.

description: I can't say enough good things about this place. I stopped here with a co-worker and loved it so much we came back the next day and brought others.  This place even won over some hummus haters!   Tried a little bit of everything and walked out stuffed!  Must go!
author: Megan P.

description: Could not recommend it more highly.  All the staff - the hostess, the waiter, the person who helped me find a plug to recharge my phone - were friendly and kind.  And had a sense of humor.  The complimentary starter salad, the food (hummus of course, in my case), the IPA, the desert (baklava) and the Turkish coffee, were all excellent.  The overall atmosphere is welcoming and comfortable.  The restaurant is well located and is clean and modern. The place is clearly well run.
author: Barry Z.

description: Really tasty, fresh hummus and pitas.  Excellent service and good value for the quality and amount of food.
author: Jeff W.

description: Tasty! Love this place so clean and food taste good, not too pricy. I love the hummus here
author: Abdullah A.

description: Don't be fooled by the fancy decor, Oren's Hummus is bland, their falafel is stale like the taste of frozen that loses two stars. It also loses two stars because they label much of the food as being Israeli, even though all the food they serve they learned from Palestinians, hummus falafel and much more items they label such as Israeli salad is in fact Arabic/Palestinian food. Should we label salsa as American salsa just because it's served in a restaurant in the us?
author: Deango R.

description: The restaurant is fairly new, I was excited to try this place as I've never had israeli food. I am sure the food is amazing but we were at the table for about ten minutes and we eventually walked out as no server acknowledged us. (There were about 3 servers that passed by us)~
author: Jon B.

description: Love the ambiance and the food in general. Staff is really nice, great culture and team. Some room on improvement on the desserts especially the Malabi.
author: Erica K.

description: OMG...we were so happy to find this place on our recent trip to SF.  Absolutely amazing food, service and ambiance. A definite must stop if you are in the area.
author: Alma C.

description: Had a very disappointing experience today. I am obessed with shakshukas and read this place was pretty especial. I booked a table and told them I only had two days in San Fran and planned our morning around this. Unfortunately the waiter got our order incorrectly, my eggs were not how I ordered them and they brought something completely different for my husband. I sent my eggs back and soon they came back but were very watery and the eggs basically had egg white..they were done in a rush even though we were already waiting for over an hour. It wasn't good, I couldn't finish. Coffee and the other dish were disappointing too. Manager was attentive and didn't charge for my dish but still think it was very overpriced for what it is.
author: Andrea S.

description: I'm Lebanese; I've been to Lebanon and Israel.  This place could be straight out of both countries. Get one of everything.  Run don't walk.
author: Stefanie G.

description: Don't bother going there for lunch. 45 mins wait for a simple hummus bowl. They have too many Caviar orders that no time to handle walk-in orders. ridiculous.
author: Eunice L.

description: Super-tasty, no wait around 8:30 on a Saturday evening. We got the rice bowl with chicken, a side skewer of chicken, the chicken schnitzel, and the hummus cauliflower. The service was friendly and efficient.
author: David O.

description: Delicious food. Great service from Ida. Friendly attentive staff. Energizing background music. Comfortable seating. What more do you want? Go already!
author: Michael G.

description: So good! Had the lamb hummus bowl with gf pita, the labane, and oren's eggplant.  All of it was delicious. Logistics/speed could use a bit of work but guessing they're still sorting out the kinks, having just recently opened. Will def be back here asap!
author: Polina M.
